website_summaries.verdict: Outdoorsy men and women who are looking for a fantastically comfortable hiking gear whose fit is unbelievably spot-on might want to set their eyes on the Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof. Adventurers in search of a footgear in which they can hike in style and without fearing the cold may find one in this product. The only thing that might irk potential owners of this product, however, is its alleged narrow width. All things considered, the Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof is a delightful Columbia offering.
pros: Based on a multitude of reports, the Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof runs true to size
The boot’s high level of comfort entranced numerous wearers
Many were floored by the mesmerizing overall aesthetics of this hiking footgear
Its A-grade warming capability stumped a decent number of reviewers
A good percentage of users adored the excellent grip performance of the Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof
Some consumers considered their purchase of this shoe a smart one
This Columbia boot impressed several owners with its remarkable waterproofing
The Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof stoked about a handful of hikers with its almost non-existent break-in period
A couple of testers raved about the shoe’s incredible lightness
cons: A few buyers found the boot’s width restrictively narrow

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots when I moved to North Dakota. Lots of snow and very cold. Moved back to the Lake of The Ozarks. They were waterproof, kept my feet warm, and the snow out in ND. I wear them a lot in the winter and when doing around the house construction and when it is wet or nasty outside. They are extremely easy to get on and off. They are some of the most comfortable shoes I own. After a year of wear they are still in like new shape. Love them, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Caligula Strange

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Hiked Mt. Monadnock with these boots, only thing that wasn't hurting me afterward were my feet! Super comfy and glad to have grabbed the pair before the trek!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: These run very narrow.... get the wides !
customer_reviews.text: While these boots look great... they don't feel so great. They really do run very narrow. Getting a size up won't help as they will be too long and still too narrow. No arch support and very limited cushioning. The grip is plenty good but your feet will be screaming at you by days end. If you do get these I recommend some 'gel' insoles at the very least and get your size in the wides.
customer_reviews.author: One

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. Hiked 15+ miles in rainy 35 degree weather, through deep & muddy puddles at times, and these boots kept my feet dry and warm the whole time. They also cleaned up perfectly so that the caked on mud didn’t stain them (I did spray a water and stain repellent on them prior to the hikes). They also look very nice, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seem to run narrow,
customer_reviews.text: The size 12 seemed snug at first -- in width, tho good in length -- but after wearing them a few hours over a few days around the house I decided they were too narrow for me and returned them. This is the first time I ever needed to go to a wide size -- maybe its the waterproofing? FWIW, I found the same fit issue with a Timberlands waterproof boot at a Dick's store. (I ordered the Timberland Men's Mt. Maddsen Hiker Boot 12 W US, and first impressions are 5 star. Here's hoping...)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Londner

customer_reviews.title: Wears out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I love the boots I’m on my 3rd pair but man do they wear out quickly. I’ve completely worn these boots out in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a back up hiking in boot in case I soaked my primary hikers in a creek or mud hole. I did not break these boots in or try them ahead of time due to time constraints. I ended up wearing them and hiking in them for almost ten days and they were terrific! Light, comfortable and they seem well made so far. I used them in Alaska in September and climbed some steep rocky terrain without any issues. The price is excellent for what you are getting in these boots! I am using them as my primary hiking boot now. I did add some additional waterproofing prior to wear but I had no issues with water.
customer_reviews.author: Scorch

customer_reviews.title: Would have been a 5 start shoe if....
customer_reviews.text: Superior comfort, light weight, feet stayed dry, you could wear them all day. I would have given them 5 stars. I had them not even two months and the soles are nearly worn smooth! Super disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking suede shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. Not so much wide even in this wide model but it is good enough for my slightly wide feet. So ppl with real wide feet will find it tough.Construction and look of the shoes are awesome but need to wait for few months to check on durability. Im happy with the look and feel of this suede leather boots especially shark/black color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish yet comfy!
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Columbia hiking boots! I wanted to big get a pair so I can wear them during the winter months, but I may be able to wear these year round! They look stylish and are very comfortable.. They seem to fit true to size. They don’t feel like they would be too hot or too cold. I bought the pair in brown suede with red laces. I like them so much, I may get a second pair in black/sharkskin Edit: got a second pair!
customer_reviews.author: JKB

customer_reviews.title: very good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Just tried on, not walked or worked. For the price, best fitting boots in all my years. I wish the arch was higher but maybe my arch is higher than average. Left side, where toes begin to slope up to the foot, it is snug/tight, compared to perfect right side. Width is also perfect for me. I also like the lacing detail. Hook eyelets that make easy off/on. 5 stars for all around very good boots for me.
customer_reviews.author: ventingisok

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable hikers
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to break the bank on a pair of boots for hiking. These boots fit well and performed well for a few moderate hikes in several national parks. For moderate hikes, these have performed well. I ended up replacing the insoles for something that is more supportive for a high arch. I saw several reviews of the top retainers being pulled out....I haven’t run into any issues but there is a different method of putting this on. Don’t tighten when they are fully laced....rather tighten as you lace them up....the laces don’t slide through the retainers which is likely why other people have had issues.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D.

customer_reviews.title: Great stylish multipurpose boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hike in New Zealand. They took a few days to break in, so I’d use them a few days before a long hike. After the break in period, these were very comfortable. I also received compliments from several hikers that liked the style. The only thing I didn’t love was that they were a little hot. Even hiking in upper 70 Fahrenheit weather, my feet hit pretty hot and my feet normally don’t sweat. I’m keeping them for winter boots in NYC as the are waterproof and warm enough for the winter. A great all around and stylish boot for the city and the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Yoder

customer_reviews.title: More hiking/lightweight than protection (but still good)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pair of shoes thinking they were more sturdy and would protect my feet more (top of them). In actuality, it is truly a hiking only boot as it is lightweight (which is great for hiking miles a day). Ultimately, I still use it and like it. It has held up thus far on bottom, top, etc, but I have taken some hits to the top of my foot that hurt more than I liked. Had I read the description more closely, I personally would have purchased something closer to a hiking boot / work boot hybrid instead of this, but still 5 stars since it’s not the boots’ fault that I didn’t read/research more.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking of for work.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this boots, very confortable, can use it all day without discomfort, true to size, good construction and materials. I decided to buy a second pair in a different color, that is how much I like these boots. Right now it is only normal use, walking and for work. One thing thought is that they are water repellent but this will not last for long, recommendation is to buy a suede water protectant for the boots and apply ir regularly, this will keep them safe from stains and water.
customer_reviews.author: Nestmac

customer_reviews.title: NARROWS AT THE TOE
customer_reviews.text: This order was a replacement of a previous Columbia 11 W. This boot feels comfortable and fits well until you get to the instep. It definitely abnormally narrows across the instep and definitely into toe. It is a strange fit, I am moving around in the heel up through mid foot, which is fine because I would wear a thicker sock with these, but then at the instep and toe it abnormally narrows. Sending them back!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Have worn well and are still comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in late April 2020 and writing this in early August 2020. These boots are great, super comfortable and have held up reasonably well given their usage. I work in landscaping on a golf course community. These boots have endured all ranges of motion as I crouch, crawl, shovel, walk spraying herbicide, shift manual transmission vehicles among other things. They have put up with mud, mulch, sand, stone, grass clippings, brush, asphalt inches of rain and high temperatures. They look very ugly now as you can see from the photos. They are still pretty water resistant and I never get home with sore feet! Definitely recommend for equal or lesser boot abusive jobs.
customer_reviews.author: WalkerandChiara

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman with wide feet so I bought these in my equivalent mens size and I really like these. They are super comfy and cushy, very happy about that. Only downside is that it's tough to get a good tightness on the ankle and I rolled my ankles around on rocks on the trail several times which pulled my muscles a lot. Next time I'll just try to get them tighter but these were the nicest hiking boots I could find for the price point, I skimmed hiking boots and read reviews for hours before settling on these, glad I got them
customer_reviews.author: jaton

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband and it was a slam dunk. Supports his ankle, affordable, waterproof, light, doesn’t press or bend awkwardly which is what he need since he’s had surgery on both of his feet! Used them on 3-10 mile hikes so far and they’ve held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to being wide
customer_reviews.text: These are only getting a three star because my wife has the women's version and she loves them. But for the men's side, these are not even close to being a wide. I tired these on when I got them with a thin pair of socks I was wearing and they barely fit. My hiking socks I would not have been able to even get my foot in the shoe. I have a lot of Columbia stuff for hiking but their shoes will not be one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Motorscar

customer_reviews.title: BEST hiking boots ever
customer_reviews.text: I wear these just to walk around the niehgborhood sometimes and other times on 5 mile mountain hikes. THEY ARE SO COMFORTABLE! Buy .5 size up as with most hiking boots - your toes need a little more room. I wear 9.5 and 10 was perfect. Great product and very comparable BUT BETTER than the merrell mid rise.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Outsole is not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about 2 months ago in preparation for my vacation to Ireland. I replaced the insole immediately because I am flat footed and have narrow feet. I found the fit to be fantastic and immediately comfortable. I wore them fairly regularly for very short walks. Then it was off to Ireland for ALOT of walking and rain. The boots are waterproof without additional treatment required. They remained comfortable. However I noticed considerable wear on and even one section of tread missing. It's worth noting that I'm 6'5" and 200 lbs so maybe this was a factor however I do believe that a few other reviewers noted the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Water proofing barely lasts a few months if used regularly.
customer_reviews.text: Own two pairs of these. The water proofing on both of them has blown out very quickly in the exact same spot. On the side in the middle where the sole connects to the boot breaks open and water just flows into there freely. The part where your heel rubs needs more padding as well as it just becomes a hard surface to get blisters from after a little while. My oldest pair is 2 years old, the second 1. The first one lasted considerably longer and was definitely slightly different from the one I got a year later.
customer_reviews.author: David Dunigan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable almost like sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Just received this pair of boots. Fitting is perfect (contrary to some of the reviews) and boots are lightweight and very comfortable, almost like a pair of sneakers. I will be trekking in parts of Nagoya (Japan) later in the week and will get back for updates. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Twilight Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Legit, waterproof hikers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the snow and they have held up surprisingly well to the task. Feet have stayed dry and with an insole (which I use in all my shoes), they are comfortable to wear and move around in. Grippy soles for sure. Stylish enough to boot, if that's your thing. Can't entirely speak to longevity as am only a month in, but they have done what's required and I have worn them much more than expected (or desired..damn, snow!).
customer_reviews.author: The Rake

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very timely, fit as expected! I normally wear a 101/2 so I ordered these a high size larger to allow for heavier hiking socks and likely a thin under sock. Fit perfect. Comfortable and although I have not used them on the trail yet, I believe they will be a great boot at a reasonable price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Lovely shoe, just didi not fit.
customer_reviews.text: Hubby is very hard to fit, so we always order 12's and 13's. Unfortunately, neither one fit. I am not sure which size this was, but the 12 was too small and the 13 was too big. AARGH! The price was really good, so we were hoping, but it was not meant to be. They were shipped quickly, packaged well, and arrived safely. They were very well made and looked like they would last a long time--which would have been good because Hubby is very hard on his boots!
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, reasonably priced, and surprisingly durable!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised about the durability of these lightweight boots. I used them as working boots instead of hiking boots. (I don't hike). I needed lightweight and comfortable shoes that looked like work boots so I could get away with working in them on the jobsite. I really didn't care for the aggressive tread but ,heck, they are hiking boots. I put them through a beating the last 11 months. They held up really well. I even have the original laces on them. Wow! I was hoping to get a good six months from them but I received 11. I'm ordering a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Beware Rough fit.Bruise feet
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed with this product, Can,t return cause the package got tossed in the garbage.I read the reviews and they seemed great.I wear these boots all day doing Amazon Courier service and they hurt my feet. There is not enough cushion on the inside soles, there hard and uncomfortable and the fit is not snug to my feet.These are not worth the value at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joe E.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for a great hike!
customer_reviews.text: They fit great, especially over the ankles and the back of the foot. The laces allow for exactly the amount of tightness you want at every position on your feet. It prevents you from twisting your ankles on uneven terrain (though you still can, if you try hard enough). There is the right amount of both support and freedom of movement that it gives. They're also really easy to clean on the outside (I haven't tried to clean the inside yet).
customer_reviews.author: Sai Parthasarathy Miduthuri

customer_reviews.title: Ft
customer_reviews.text: Pros: fairly lightweight Comfortable fit Warm enough in colder temps Good grip on both loose and hard surfaces Construction seems like it’ll hold up for a long time, at least for my usage. Water resistant Cons: after doing some hiking in Moab back in April I’ve decided these are more suited to colder weather. I wasn’t even in heavy hiking socks and my feet were cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable with good traction
customer_reviews.text: Just used these on a long hike and I cannot explain how comfortable they are. I ordered the 11 wide because I have wide feet and they gave me enough wiggle room but not too much. No blisters, no sore feet and had amazing traction on the rocky terrain. I am impressed. I have had many $100+ hiking boots in the past and always had issues. These treated me well. I will definitely order again. Now let's see how long they last!
customer_reviews.author: Thatoneoverthere

customer_reviews.title: Still Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: A great boot that fits about right, but more on the snug side. The suede part is soft compared the standard Newton Ridge boots, but the same cushioned comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Superb fit and comfort  (size 91⁄2)
customer_reviews.text: I liked the style which is what motivated the purchase. I then hoped the size was appropriate (not too small or large to what a 91⁄2 is supposed to be), which it was. And then I also hoped it would fit well. Great surprise - my most comfortable to wear of all the shoes and hikers I own. This pair fits better than the other Columbia hiker I bought (which was a little less expensive with less style).
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boot So Far!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Boots are very comfortable and true to size. I work as a garbage man so I’m on my feet walking in different weather conditions everyday. I don’t know if I would call these waterproof more like water resistant but I will do a follow up after a few months if they hold up and get a chance to test out the “waterproof-ness” My only negative is I wish they were available as a composite toe but I’m not going to knock off a star for that. The color combo (Shark/black) is amazing and I’m thinking of ordering these as an everyday shoe as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: They fit!
customer_reviews.text: These boots were comfortable right out of the box. I haven't worn them anywhere other than inside my house when I opened the box, but I foresee no break-in period. I typically wear size 11, but I've been discovering too many boots fit far too tight, especially around the toes. For this reason, I ordered a Wide size. What a difference. I highly recommend these boots just based on fit. They appear to be well made, so hopefully, they will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Don L. Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be a good product - but very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in the Wide Version - which I typically try to go to for all my shoes. Needless to say - they were still very, very snug & I will be returning them. The wide version fits like a regular version. IF you have wide feet - I suggest looking for a different pair of hiking boots, as these will probably not fit. Especially if you like to wear two pairs of socks when you are hiking, as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Enrico C. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the best. a week ago we were hiking and i slipped on some wet moss in my old boots. Went back to the same spot and the boots gripped well no sliping. Columbia are the best hiking boots I have used. bEtter that some of the other brands as well. Took my new boots on a nine mile hike on moderate to advanced trails. they grip great. My weight is 225lbs I was standing on a rock and puit my weight on one shoe and eas at an 90 degree angel and they did not slip. Colombia has the best hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Tolbert

customer_reviews.title: Great performance on a budget
customer_reviews.text: These boots over exceeded my expectations.... They re light, grippy, pretty well done I just came from the mountains three days backbacking crossing rivers 35 to 40 pounds load they worked... The cons. The laces are too thick I replaced them with my old ones... And they dont breath...take long to dry once they get wet... but that is something obvious Over all: Great product with outstanding performance.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Socias

customer_reviews.title: Like sneakers, but sturdier.
customer_reviews.text: They are warm and comfortable. They are a little heavy she said, since my wife usually wears sneakers and her sneakers were wearing away too fast so I decided to get these. I like my older version so I got one for her and the mens version looked less plain comparing to the women's version. She uses it at work and is a nurse hasn't complained yet or I would've known already.
customer_reviews.author: Megatron Amazon

customer_reviews.title: VERY good boots for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots for my son to wear for occasinal hikes or work trips. Since they wouldn't be used frequently I didn't want to pay a ton for boots. I got these and they are actually much nicer than I expected. They are very comfortable. Required no break in and my son loves them. I can highly recommend these for anyone who needs some occasional use boots that don't break the bank. VERY VERY much worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke Flint

customer_reviews.title: If you have bunion feet, definitely get the wide
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and water proof. Has a lot of padding around the ankle and with my bunions, they feel a little tight around the toes. The top of the boot feels almost like a steel toe boot without the discomfort. Was cheaper than buying on Colombia's main site. Not a ton of cushion in the soles but has pretty good arch support. The tread is huge and is about 5 or 6 mm (about a third of a dime for you non-metric folks).
customer_reviews.author: Shania

customer_reviews.title: A bit too narrow
customer_reviews.text: My husband normally wears standard size 11. Due to the recommendations we bought exactly this size. Even though my husband never had any issues with the widths of his shoes, this shoe however felt too narrow. That's why we bought another pair, but this time size 11 "wide". Indeed this boots had been a tiny little bit wider. Nevertheless they had been still too narrow for my husband's foot. We had to return both pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Lara

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not very wide
customer_reviews.text: I wear a lot of Columbia boots and need a wide boot which is sometimes hard to find in what I want. These are nice boots,. not a work boot or if you use them for serious hiking I would not get the suede. But my only dislike to them is I ordered a wide and they sure feel like a medium width. Being suede though after breaking them in as always they will get a lot wider and then the front of the boot will start to curl upwards. Overall though not a bad boot to wear occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Powell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put these boots on I was impressed with how comfortable they were. No break in time and after wearing them for a month they are still easy to wear. Lightweight yet the sole seems stury and the grip is good. Recommended as a good lightweight hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: mtnman

customer_reviews.title: "I like them!" - my husband
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband to wear to work. He is on his feet most of every day, outdoors in all weather, so comfortable and waterproof were two must-haves. I just said, "Hey, I'm going to review your boots, what do you think of them?", and he replied, "I like them!". He thinks they are comfortable and we just had a few pretty nasty, rainy days, and his feet stayed dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Siggins

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I use a work boot. Not super tough but as i do not swing a hammer anymore they work great. I walk all day on concrete in the construction industry. My feet feel happy when i get home. They are pretty light. Con is that they do not breathe much so if you have sweaty feet you will have sweaty feet. Besides that very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Good for cosmetic looks only not something you will use for having work , workplace or even camping
customer_reviews.text: I really like the shoe based on the cosmetics feels good. However what I dislike about the issue, I don't think it was designed for heavy use the shoe is starting to break down and I work at a recycling center. Thank the less I'm not actually backpacking and camping like I normally do these kinds of boots. It probably would give away will quickly on a backpacking trip
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L. Winston

customer_reviews.title: Columbia Research and Development nailed it with the materials and design for these boots!
customer_reviews.text: The extreme durability and comfort of these boots was so impressive! I have a custom rustic furniture business and spend countless hours on my feet at the shop, averaging 14 hours a day, six days a week. I dont mind the extra hours if my feet are happy! For the last 8 months, I put these boots through the gauntlet, through every possible condition at work and play and they have passed my tests! Cant wait to cinch up some new ones>
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I out around 140 miles in then in 4 months...
customer_reviews.text: ...as I said I out these through insane hikes. Some 26 Mike day hikes. They have held up amazingly. I have put my leg up to my knee in water multiple times. Still water resistant. I had multiple people compliment how the water beads right off. At first they were really stiff but now the comfort is amazing. Will probably buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: good light weight mud boots
customer_reviews.text: I work on a muddy farm and these survived a day romping in wet clay really well. They are great boots that are more like heavy duty sneakers than a hiking boot. I think I will need to upgrade the insole because the ball my feet hurt at end of day. That's where these are lighter duty than traditional boots, the sole has good tread though.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: More like water repellent..
customer_reviews.text: At around 30 sec mark water started to leak in first through tongue then through sides of the shoes. Tried to dry them for 24 hours but haven't dried yet. My timeberland boots dry within an hour. For 63 bucks it is decent for water repellent shoes so ill keep it but that description is bs sorry but not sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Sun kyu, Choi

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: What a great boot! The comfort has really surprised me. Not using as an everyday work boot for me...mainly just for casual winter wear and occasional yardwork including shoveling snow and raking leaves. Have worn on a couple of snowy/ icy days and they provided good warmth and good grip in the snow. Very well constructed and actually good looking for a work/hiking style boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E Mark

customer_reviews.title: Look and fit GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Like the hiking boot/shoe style. Ordered the Wide in my size. Fits great. These have the top hook? for the strings as opposed to an eyelet. Gave a 5 star on the water resistance though have not had this specific pair in the water yet. Like the lace color and style. Rate among my favorite footwear. My opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Not really waterproof!!
customer_reviews.text: I had Columbia hiking shoes before and I know how comfy they are. Though this one is comfy, however I was disappointed that it's not really waterproof as advertised. I tried wearing it in the recent snow and just walking on the snow the right shoe let's water in and my sock got wet. I haven't even tried to step in water or river while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Anas Sami Al-Smadi

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. I wore them hiking in the mountains. They are a little warm, but not uncomfortable. They are very padded and feel very well made. The traction is great. I wore them hiking across mud and rock and did not slide. They fit my feet just right.
customer_reviews.author: XV123

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected, waterproof and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These fit great! I have a narrow foot and they fit snug in my feet which I need when hiking. These may not fit well on someone with wide feet. These are waterproof the little water I have been in, I haven’t fully submerged them. Comfortable to wear all day and the look great out hiking and around town gathering TP during this apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: FTF Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good for cosmetic use, but not for hard for heavy work.
customer_reviews.text: The blue is well, cosmetic wise it looks great. However I don't think this boot is designed for heavy use. I've used other hiking shoes before for work and for backpacking, but this shoe is starting to break down a little bit. I'm a little surprised but it is what it is. Hopefully it will last me a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L. Winston

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it... How it fits, feels snug but comfortable.. the quality made.. and how the suede feels.. I had a chance to use it for hiking.. and it feels great. Good grips and keep my feet dry and warm. size wise I think it runs big. I got this through prime wardrobe comparing it with 2 timberlands.. and I kept this and ret the timberlands.
customer_reviews.author: Bogel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these hiking boots for field & trail work when volunteering and light hiking. True to size and very comfortable - did not need any breaking in. Waterproof in rain and wet fields. I have not 'dunked' them in a stream, though. Had these about 2 1/2 months now and so far, so good. Would buy again if they continue to perform over time.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot
customer_reviews.text: My favorite “work” boot. Most boots take days, even weeks to break in. To me, it barely took a day. I’ve been wearing these nearly 5x a week for a year straight and have zero complaints about them. They repel water pretty good, the support is great and they’re really durable. Hopefully they will still be for sale when I need a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: 15 Strong
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the best everyday wearing boots that I've ever had!! I really enjoy the comfortable warmth Columbia has provided. I've worn them all day working in receiving, the loading dock, and more. The size 15 is perfect for my big dogs! Talk about an excellent buy for this Chicagoan!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Chambers II

customer_reviews.title: What a value! Look like Herman Survivors. Insanely durable. Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been rehabbing a house, solo, for the past 18 months, I spend massive amounts of heavy-wear time in these shoes. They are comfortable, extremely durable -extremely - and I like the way they look. I also like that they remind me of the popular Herman Survivors of the 1980s! I almost want to stock up on these. Barring funerals, I see no reason to ever own another shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Waste.
customer_reviews.text: Wayyyy too small. I am a woman who wears a 10.5 wide in women’s shoes. I ordered a 9.5 wide in these men’s hiking boots and by noon I couldn’t walk. They’re narrow, tight around mid foot and ankles. Bummer. In the trash they go. Never buy Columbia’s again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Never have i had a boot this good in all my life!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 55yrs old and have had many boots in my years, and I'm talking $$$ boots big name brands. Well look no further people this boot is the best in every aspect. I don't write negative reviews , but I do write positive reviews when absolutely necessary. Don't scratch your head, JUST BUY THEM!!!
customer_reviews.author: CAMOUFLAGE CARL

customer_reviews.title: Extremely narrow, even the wides
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 10.5, occasionally a wide. I tried the 10.5 and 10.5w and they were both extremely tight on the side (my foot was bulging out and it was jamming in my pinky toe). The length was perfect. I've never tried on such a narrow shoe/boot.
customer_reviews.author: NevermoreFU

customer_reviews.title: Sure-footed
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at how much I like these boots--the way they look and the experience of wearing them. They're light and they feel good on my feet, so I notice I'm less eager than I am with my Keens to take them off when I come inside. They're easy and quick to take on and off. I've been wearing them to cut and carry firewood on steep snow-covered hillsides, and the grip of the soles hasn't failed me, in icier or in slushy snow. They're insulated enough for my feet to stay warm down to around 20 degrees, and they have room for thicker socks if it's a little colder.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Vandermeulen

customer_reviews.title: Get some gel insoles, and these boots are great. (So far).
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good, still breaking in. Replaced insole with Amazon pick gel insole, were loose in heel, now they are a perfect fit. Gel sole is much more comfortable over original. Let u know how they hold up after my next two trips to the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: DCTex

customer_reviews.title: Ready-to-wear and feels great
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable with a couple optional lace-ties in case you want more ankle-movement. The grip is amazing and cuts through even heavily-packed snow for impressive traction. Warm and seems somewhat water resistant, highly recommend these boots. I wear them all day in the winters. Didn't even have that weird factory smell most shoes seem to have out of the box, so a nice plus.
customer_reviews.author: John Hawkey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: Fit is great and it's quite comfortable. Right out of the box they were good, no sore spots or blisters on my feet. I give it only three stars because only time will tell if they will last. I walk a lot so they will be put to the test and often.
customer_reviews.author: Rick D. Huff

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Took these out for my first time. 2.5 miles up to 3000 foot elevation on a narrow, rocky trail. These were very comfortable and do not seem to need a break in period. Much more stable than the first time I did this hike in running shoes. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clark G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Smithers
customer_reviews.text: These are the best waterproof boot you can get that has wide available. These don't breath as well in the summer for all day wear, so I can't recommend them for that, but for general hiking and even casual winter / streets, these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: John Dandell

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in February, worn only on dog walks in grass. Amazon wants reviews right away, most of their stuff is great out of the box and not so great after a short period of time. These boots are NOT waterproof, they look nice and fit good, but these pics are simply walking dogs in the morning dew. That's it, socks are completely soaked after 15 minutes in dew.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Isn't Great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my boyfriend for his birthday. The first pair came in the mail and he tried them on and they were too big. So I sent them back and ordered a size down. They arrived and he said that now they were too tight. So I returned them again and ordered the same size but the wide version. These came in the mail and we finally had a match! It was a lot of work for the right size but he actually loved them and they look really nice. I'd recommend these, just be ready to struggle with the size a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: great work and play boots
customer_reviews.text: these boots are pretty close to indestructible. after 6 months of wear even the shoe laces are in tact. very comfortable with lots of wiggle room for the toes. I wear them every day for 12 to 14 hours and they are still comfortable. Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: William L. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Comfort & Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for hiking. Provides the support you need when doing a big hike. Did a 10 mile hike one day in these and they withstood mud and water. Kept my feet comfortable and prevented injuries to my ankle. Highly recommended for hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Very IMPRESSED!!!
customer_reviews.text: These by far are the best hiking boots I ever owned. Extremely comfortable and durable! I hiked with them right out of the box with no issues. I have had problems with my right foot in the past. Both plantar fasciitis and a bunion. With these boots neither issue has been a problem. Since I have had them I have gone on anywhere from 7-14 mile hikes on very rocky terrain and the boots have held up very well. Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: Denny Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good, but just good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace another pair of Columbia boots. These are good, but they tend to be less firm in the soles so there is more movement when you walk. They are good for day to day use, but I wouldn’t go hiking in them as the support just isn’t there.
customer_reviews.author: desertbear

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots.
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable. Good looking and well made. I’ve only worn them in the house and am looking forward to getting outside this spring. I have narrow feet and they actually fit pretty good maybe a thicker insole will make them just right. I’m not sure if these would be great for heavy hiking but certainly great for moderate hikes. Nice, great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Portly

customer_reviews.title: Endorsed by a Portland Dog Walker for comfort, dryness, and fit.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable. Great fit. Warm and dry. I’m a dog walker in Portland so it’s been me walking dogs in the rain for the past two months. 8-10 miles a day and not once have my feet hurt, been cold, or been wet. Great traction, easy to put on, easily taken off, and well made. These are by far the most comfortable boots I’ve ever owned and they hold up to the rigors of long rainy walks in Portland.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Fielder

customer_reviews.title: Good but slightly tight.
customer_reviews.text: Product came fairly quick, looks good overall. I had previously tried on the shoes at a store but the shoes I received from Amazon fit tighter than expected. They should work and I’m going to keep them, but it could be a consistency issue.
customer_reviews.author: AKbeeNewbie

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hiking shoes. They keep my feet warm in the snow and don’t get too hot when it’s warm outside. Only thing I dislike are the insoles, I recommend throwing those away and buying proper ones.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great boot so far.
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time looking to replace my Timberland boots and finally came across these. Very pleased with the fit, look and comfort. Time will tell regarding durability. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: michael donovan

customer_reviews.title: Never be too big for your boots
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots expecially for the price. I put them on right out of the box for a 8 mile hike. They didn't need any breaking in and my feet felt great. They offer good ankle support and protection from cactus and other pokey things!
customer_reviews.author: jeikamp

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my grandson who just moved to Michigan. He loves them and can't wait for bad weather so he can wear them more often. They look great and fit perfectly. He says they're warm. I'd buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Just Vic

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for my foot
customer_reviews.text: Overall i loved the boots appearance and quality. After trying it on, i found it was too narrow for my feet. I wear 11.5 shoes and always goes 13 boots. Overall i wished they would fit me but i naturally have wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: bwong247

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my boyfriend as a Christmas gift. He has somewhat of a wide foot but they fit him perfectly in his normal shoe size (compare to Vans, Adidas). He works in the rain and on his feet all day and they have kept his feet warm and dry while also being super comfortable. He has worn them for a month now and they still look great and he still loves them! No more complaining about sore, wet feet!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace my old Timberlands. They're still going strong but they're just old. These boots fit great. They are super warm. Wearing them in my office and my feet are so hot! Nice design. I hope the metal hooks hold up well for the laces. Great replacement for my Timberlands so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chacho92

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to Costa Rica. Didn't break them in first and when I did hike fifteen miles in one day I didn't have any rubs or blisters. Nice and comfortable, held up on rugged terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Jane T.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and fitting hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes the feel comfortable on all terrains. I like the ankle support and general fit of the shoe, very snug and comfortable. Very good looking shoes also, glad I purchased them and I'm fairly picky.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Wall

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 19 yr old and hooks bend when he ties them and the laces snapped. Not to impressed that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Nice would recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots very comfortable very lightweight I'm a big guy so foot Comfort is important
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have gotten for my brother for his birthday. He loves these boots!! He suffers from gout and he says these boots are so comfortable to hike and walk around in.
customer_reviews.author: Merygurl

customer_reviews.title: Yellowstone tried & proved!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable shoe/boot I’ve had in a long time. Only thing I’d change is to make it a bit wider, for when I’ve been on my feet a while. Still, it’s a great boot and Yellowstone proven. ...and my dad thinks they look sharp. :)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B. Schlaeger

customer_reviews.title: Comfy. Easy to break-in
customer_reviews.text: Took them on a 4hr hike in the Blue Ridge mountains with about an inch of powdery snow on the ground. They keep my feet warm and dry. The cushion sole was gentle on my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Good boot at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, I have Psoiatic Arthritis and feet get painful. Size was suprisingly true and narrow which i need. Laces are not great (can't just pull them tight from top). Over all very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mattocks

customer_reviews.title: not slip resistant
customer_reviews.text: Boots are waterproof. haven't had an issue with wet feet. These boots do NOT have a slip resistant sole, nearly slipped on pavement wearing this. Overall pretty happy with them would be 5 star if these was slip resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Lacee Mantova

customer_reviews.title: If you have a wide foot, these are not for you.
customer_reviews.text: This pair of shoes looks like a very good product. However, even though I ordered a wide size, they wereway too narrow for my feet. As a result, I had to return them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy in Danville, Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about a week, and so far, I'm happy. My size 13's fit as expected. They're snug, but not too tight. Good toe room. Overall comfort is good, but I'm still breaking them in. (No long hikes yet, but I've worn them for a full day with no issues.) Construction seems solid. We'll see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre and Gary

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but......
customer_reviews.text: 4 months into wearing these boots. Very comfy. Exterior is wearing well, but the lining in the heal cup has a wear hole already in each boot. Now that I examine closer it probably is not a performance material. They have been used for cold weather daily wear. No hiking. Probably would buy something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Newton Ridge Plus Ii Suede Waterproof Boot, Breathable with High-Traction Grip Hiking
product_meta.description:
Every hiking enthusiast need a boot that can withstand anything while maintain its integrity and style—that's why Columbia made the Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof boot. It's designed with expert craftsmanship and superior materials, making it the ultimate companion for rigorous days out on the trail. High quality materials are first and foremost on Columbia's list of requirements when designing and creating men's trail and hiking footwear. These boots combine durability and comfort seamlessly while remaining lightweight and stylish.

Columbia's signature technology is what sets us apart— it ensures high-quality protection and prevention. This men's hiking boot features a suede and leather waterproof exterior to protect from trail to mountain range; drizzle to downpour. The advanced high traction outsole works hard to tread grip in every environment to prevent slipping, while the signature lightweight midsole provides long-lasting comfort and superior cushioning for impact absorption and high energy return. Responsive, supportive cushioning and super-grippy rubber outsoles are geared and ready for any distance and terrain: miles over rocks, grass, gravel, and roots. The combination of performance, durability and style make this Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof boot every man's hiking staple.

Columbia offers our Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof Boot in multiple colors and sizes. To ensure the size you choose is right, please utilize our sizing chart.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: This Columbia Men's Newton Ridge Plus II Suede Waterproof hiking boot features our signature lightweight midsole for long-lasting comfort, superior cushioning, and high energy return as well as our high-traction grip outsole.
QUALITY MATERIALS: Waterproof suede and leather make up the construction of this boot for a protective yet stylish silhouette and build.
ADJUSTABLE FEATURES: A lace-up closure ensures an adjustable, secure fit.
DURABILITY: Metal hardware and a seam-sealed construction makes this hiking boot durable enough to withstand rain, muck, puddles, and more.

OMNI-GRIP: This multi-terrain traction system matches specially formulated compounds and treads to specific environments. A dual-zone winter tread pattern ensures solid footing on surfaces such as ice and snow.
